00034 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00035  * (function: make_full_ref_name)
00036 // {previous_string}.module_name+instance_name
00037 // {previous_string}.module_name+instance_name^signal_name
00038 // {previous_string}.module_name+instance_name^signal_name-bit
00039  *-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00040 char *make_full_ref_name(char *previous, char *module_name, char *module_instance_name, char *signal_name, int bit)
00041 {
00042         char *return_string;
00043         return_string = (char*)malloc(sizeof(char)*1);
00044         return_string[0] = '\0';
00045 
00046         if (previous != NULL)
00047         {
00048                 return_string = (char*)realloc(return_string, sizeof(char)*(strlen(previous)+1+1));
00049                 sprintf(return_string, "%s", previous);
00050         }
00051         if (module_name != NULL)
00052         {
00053                 return_string = (char*)realloc(return_string, sizeof(char)*(strlen(return_string)+1+strlen(module_name)+1+strlen(module_instance_name)+1));
00054                 sprintf(return_string, "%s.%s+%s", return_string, module_name, module_instance_name);
00055         }
00056         if ((signal_name != NULL) && ((previous != NULL) || ((module_name != NULL))))
00057         {
00058                 return_string = (char*)realloc(return_string, sizeof(char)*(strlen(return_string)+1+strlen(signal_name)+1));
00059                 sprintf(return_string, "%s^%s", return_string, signal_name);
00060         }
00061         else if (signal_name != NULL) 
00062         {
00063                 return_string = (char*)realloc(return_string, sizeof(char)*(strlen(return_string)+1+strlen(signal_name)+1));
00064                 sprintf(return_string, "%s", signal_name);
00065         }
00066         if (bit != -1)
00067         {
00068                 oassert(signal_name != NULL);
00069                 return_string = (char*)realloc(return_string, sizeof(char)*(strlen(return_string)+1+10+1));
00070                 sprintf(return_string, "%s-%d", return_string, bit);
00071         }
00072         return return_string;   
00073 }

00075 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00076  * (function: convert_int_to_bit_string)
00077  * Outputs a string msb to lsb.  For example, 3 becomes "011"
00078  *-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00079 char *convert_long_to_bit_string(long long orig_long, int num_bits)
00080 {
00081         int i;
00082         char *return_val = (char*)malloc(sizeof(char)*(num_bits+1));
00083         int mask = 1;
00084 
00085         for (i = num_bits-1; i >= 0; i--)
00086         {
00087                 if((mask & orig_long) > 0)
00088                 {
00089                         return_val[i] = '1';    
00090                 }
00091                 else
00092                 {
00093                         return_val[i] = '0';    
00094                 }
00095                 mask = mask << 1;
00096         }
00097         return_val[num_bits] = '\0';
00098         
00099         return return_val;
00100 }

00102 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00103  * (function: convert_dec_string_of_size_to_int)
00104  *-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00105 long long convert_dec_string_of_size_to_long(char *orig_string, int size)
00106 {
00107         int i;
00108         long long return_value = 0;
00109         long long current_base_value = 1;
00110         char temp[2];
00111 
00112         if (strlen(orig_string) > 19)
00113         {
00114                 /* greater than our bit capacity so not a constant 64 bits */
00115                 return -1;
00116         }
00117 
00118         for (i = strlen(orig_string)-1; i > -1; i--)
00119         {
00120                 if (isdigit(orig_string[i]))
00121                 {
00122                         sprintf(temp, "%c", orig_string[i]);
00123                         return_value += (long long)(atoi(temp) * current_base_value);
00124                 }
00125                 else
00126                 {
00127                         error_message(PARSE_ERROR, -1, -1, "This suspected decimal number (%s) is not\n", orig_string);
00128                 }
00129                 current_base_value *= 10;
00130         }
00131         
00132         return return_value;
00133 }

00135 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00136  * (function: convert_hex_string_of_size_to_int)
00137  *-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00138 long long convert_hex_string_of_size_to_long(char *orig_string, int size)
00139 {
00140         int i;
00141         long long return_value = 0;
00142         long long current_base_value = 1;
00143         char temp[2];
00144 
00145         if (strlen(orig_string) > 16)
00146         {
00147                 /* greater than our bit capacity so not a constant */
00148                 return -1;
00149         }
00150 
00151         for (i = strlen(orig_string)-1; i > -1; i--)
00152         {
00153                 if (isdigit(orig_string[i]))
00154                 {
00155                         sprintf(temp, "%c", orig_string[i]);
00156                         return_value += (long long)(atoi(temp) * current_base_value);
00157                 }
00158                 else if ((orig_string[i] == 'a') || (orig_string[i] == 'A'))
00159                 {
00160                         return_value += (long long)(10 * current_base_value);
00161                 }
00162                 else if ((orig_string[i] == 'b') || (orig_string[i] == 'B'))
00163                 {
00164                         return_value += (long long)(11 * current_base_value);
00165                 }
00166                 else if ((orig_string[i] == 'c') || (orig_string[i] == 'C'))
00167                 {
00168                         return_value += (long long)(11 * current_base_value);
00169                 }
00170                 else if ((orig_string[i] == 'd') || (orig_string[i] == 'D'))
00171                 {
00172                         return_value += (long long)(11 * current_base_value);
00173                 }
00174                 else if ((orig_string[i] == 'e') || (orig_string[i] == 'E'))
00175                 {
00176                         return_value += (long long)(11 * current_base_value);
00177                 }
00178                 else if ((orig_string[i] == 'f') || (orig_string[i] == 'F'))
00179                 {
00180                         return_value += (long long)(11 * current_base_value);
00181                 }
00182                 else
00183                 {
00184                         error_message(PARSE_ERROR, -1, -1, "This suspected hex number (%s) is not\n", orig_string);
00185                 }
00186                 current_base_value *= 16;
00187         }
00188         
00189         return return_value;
00190 }

00192 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00193  * (function: convert_oct_string_of_size_to_int)
00194  *-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00195 long long convert_oct_string_of_size_to_long(char *orig_string, int size)
00196 {
00197         int i;
00198         long long return_value = 0;
00199         long long current_base_value = 1;
00200         char temp[2];
00201 
00202         if (strlen(orig_string) > 21)
00203         {
00204                 /* greater than our bit capacity so not a constant */
00205                 return -1;
00206         }
00207 
00208         for (i = strlen(orig_string)-1; i > -1; i--)
00209         {
00210                 if (isdigit(orig_string[i]))
00211                 {
00212                         oassert(atoi(temp) < 8);
00213                         sprintf(temp, "%c", orig_string[i]);
00214                         return_value += (long long)(atoi(temp) * current_base_value);
00215                 }
00216                 else
00217                 {
00218                         error_message(PARSE_ERROR, -1, -1, "This suspected oct number (%s) is not\n", orig_string);
00219                 }
00220                 current_base_value *= 8;
00221         }
00222         
00223         return return_value;
00224 }

00226 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00227  * (function: convert_binary_string_of_size_to_int)
00228  *-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00229 long long convert_binary_string_of_size_to_long(char *orig_string, int size)
00230 {
00231         int i;
00232         long long return_value = 0;
00233         long long current_base_value = 1;
00234         char temp[2];
00235 
00236         if (strlen(orig_string) > 63)
00237         {
00238                 /* greater than our bit capacity so not a constant */
00239                 return -1;
00240         }
00241 
00242         for (i = strlen(orig_string)-1; i > -1; i--)
00243         {
00244                 if ((tolower(orig_string[i]) == 'x') || (tolower(orig_string[i]) == 'z'))
00245                 {
00246                         /* this can't be converted to a decimal value */
00247                         return -1;
00248                 }
00249                 else if (isdigit(orig_string[i]))
00250                 {
00251                         sprintf(temp, "%c", orig_string[i]);
00252                         oassert(atoi(temp) < 2);
00253                         return_value += (long long)(atoi(temp) * current_base_value);
00254                 }
00255                 else
00256                 {
00257                         error_message(PARSE_ERROR, -1, -1, "This suspected binary number (%s) is not\n", orig_string);
00258                 }
00259                 current_base_value *= 2;
00260         }
00261         
00262         return return_value;
00263 }

00265 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00266  * (function: my_power)
00267  *      My own simple power function
00268  *-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00269 long long int my_power(long long int x, long long int y)
00270 {
00271         int i;
00272         long long int value;
00273 
00274         if (y == 0)
00275         {
00276                 return 1;
00277         }
00278 
00279         value = x;
00280 
00281         for (i = 1; i < y; i++)
00282         {
00283                 value *= x;
00284         }
00285 
00286         return value;
00287 }

00289 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00290  *  (function: make_simple_name )
00291  *-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00292 char *make_string_based_on_id(nnode_t *node)
00293 {
00294         char *return_string;
00295 
00296         return_string = (char*)malloc(sizeof(char)*(20+2)); // any unique id greater than 20 characters means trouble
00297 
00298         sprintf(return_string, "n%ld", node->unique_id);
00299 
00300         return return_string;
00301 }

00303 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00304  *  (function: make_simple_name )
00305  *-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00306 char *make_simple_name(char *input, char *flatten_string, char flatten_char)
00307 {
00308         int i;
00309         int j;
00310         char *return_string;
00311         oassert(input != NULL);
00312 
00313         return_string = (char*)malloc(sizeof(char)*(strlen(input)+1));
00314 
00315         for (i = 0; i < strlen(input); i++)
00316         { 
00317                 return_string[i] = input[i];
00318                 for (j = 0; j < strlen(flatten_string); j++)
00319                 {
00320                         if (input[i] == flatten_string[j])
00321                         {
00322                                 return_string[i] = flatten_char;
00323                                 break;
00324                         }
00325                 }
00326         }
00327 
00328         return_string[strlen(input)] = '\0';    
00329 
00330         return return_string;
00331 }

00333 /*-----------------------------------------------------------------------
00334  *  * (function: my_malloc_struct )
00335  *   *-----------------------------------------------------------------*/
00336 void *my_malloc_struct(int bytes_to_alloc)
00337 {
00338         void *allocated = NULL;
00339         static long int m_id = 0;
00340 
00341         // ways to stop the execution at the point when a specific structure is built
00342 //oassert(m_id != 33168);
00343 
00344         allocated = malloc(bytes_to_alloc);
00345         if(allocated == NULL) 
00346         {
00347                 fprintf(stderr,"MEMORY FAILURE\n"); 
00348                 oassert (0);
00349         }
00350 
00351         /* mark the unique_id */
00352         *((long int*)allocated) = m_id; 
00353 
00354         m_id++;
00355 
00356         return(allocated);
00357 }
00358 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00359  * (function: pow2 )
00360  *-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00361 long long int pow2(int to_the_power)
00362 {
00363         int i;
00364         long long int return_val = 1;
00365 
00366         for (i = 0; i < to_the_power; i++)
00367         {
00368                 return_val = return_val << 1;
00369         }
00370 
00371         return return_val;
00372 }
